comment: I liked last years better. I thought it was a better mix of the oak and bourbon. The wood favors are a bit much for me. Glad I have a bottle of last years left.
Sweeter than expected. A lot like a golden brown marshmallow over a campfire. Not where it catches fire and gets charred, but where it takes 10 min. to get it perfectly carmelized on all sides.

Good lord this is a good bourbon. Banana, vanilla and pineapple right up front. If that's the characteristic you like in your bourbon, you found it. Price is kinda high though. Something similar that's cheaper (but a little less profound) would be Old Forrester Original. Love them both.
Good, but not worth the money over the regular bourbon.
Tried at hay markets and it was delicious. I remember it being sweeter
Very smooth and a little hot.
Brilliantly executed robust flavor with a viscous body for a 91 proof spirit. Well done.
Sweet nose. Hints of honey and caramel. Slight bite at back of tongue. Nice sipping bourbon. Better on a rock than neat.
Beautiful notes of vanilla a cask with a end of  rye punch to the nostrils
Nice sipping bourbon. Just a splash of water added. At Grillfish restaurant in Lexington Kentucky.
Marshmallow and vanilla. Campfire. Smooth and sweet. You can really taste the toasted barrel.
Preferentially the flavor on the back end has a little too much bite.
Favorite rye right now. Little bit of coconut and smooth

Tasted at Haymarket in Louisville

The nose is vanilla, baking spices, freshly baked bread. 
Thicker mouthfeel. Sweet, some caramel, some cola, and leather.
A lighter finish. On the medium side.
It’s good for sure, but would not seek it out or pay stupid money for it.
The toasted barrel comes through with typical Michter’s smoothness.  Very close to the American whisky but taking the richness of flavors to a new level
I was disappointed, especially at this price point and compared to their toasted barrel rye.
Smooth, somewhat sweet, dash of spice
Figs and twigs, slight brine not much sweetness on the nose. Slight smokiness, honey and leather taste. Figs and slight brine on the finish with a medium length and a hint of smoke.
Slightly woody and sweet on nose. Very sweet upfront with a long taste that ends earthy. Interesting taste but very good
Sweet, smooth, delicious. Enjoyed at the source.

Drinking this room temp nice.  Has a full flavor and finishes with a nice oaky taste.  With a large cube, it smooths out.  For just an 8 year old, I really like it.  (For the record, giving anything above a 4 will be tough.
Easy to drink. Not much burn flavor ok.
